author: Jaclyn Shambaugh, Staff writer
title: Jack Britt beats South View 45-7
text:
Jack Britt beats South View 45-7 By Jaclyn Shambaugh, Staff writer 
Jack Britt coach Brian Rimpf said the Buccaneers’ big-deficit win over South View, a 45-7 final, came down to the little things. 
“We talked this week about how small things can add up to the larger picture,” the coach said. “We want to win, and we want to score a lot of points, and the small things on every single down add up to that.” 
With the win, Britt improves to 8-1 overall and 4-0 in the Mid-South 4-A Conference. The Bucs are the only team in the league without a conference loss. They travel next week to Cape Fear, which is in second place in the Mid-South with a 3-1 league record after Friday’s loss to E.E. Smith. 
Against South View (2-8, 0-5 Mid-South), the Bucs jumped out to a 31-0 lead in the first quarter, capitalizing on a pair of interceptions, a blocked punt and four short-field drives in the opening frame. 
The Bucs scored on the opening drive, going 55 yards on six plays, including a 1-yard scoring run by quarterback Bryan Bryant. 
Bryant has a second running touchdown in the first quarter, a 43-yard break up the middle. He finished the night with 81 yards rushing on six carries. 
He threw for 124 yards, completing six of 10 attempts. Bryant’s top target was Keshawn Wynn, who caught four passes for 96 yards and a touchdown. 
“This was about everybody making the effort to do their part,” Wynn said. “When everybody does their part and makes plays, we’re going to win.” 
A running clock, which is automatic in the second half of games which reached a 42-point margin, was implemented before halftime. 
The Tigers got on the board in the third quarter when freshman quarterback Donovan Brewington capped an eight-play, 74-yard drive with a 5-yard scramble across the goal line. 
Tigers’ coach Rodney Brewington said his team was “overwhelmed” by Britt’s speed, size and experience. 
“I hope that team goes on to represent us in the state championship,” Brewington said. “I think that is state champion-quality team. I’m pulling for the Mid-South and anybody that makes it out of our conference.” 
Staff writer Jaclyn Shambaugh can be reached at 609-0651 or shambaughj@fayobserver.com .
